result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Miles C Harvey

defendant.name: Harvey, Miles C

records.addlTxt:
10:36 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Defendant Miles C Harvey appeared by video in custody from New Lisbon Correctional.  Attorney Maura Ann Mcmahon appeared by video for Miles C Harvey. 
Atty Mcmahon states she did go to Dodge County to see defendant and they had moved him so she was unable to see him. 
Defendant did receive the discovery in this matter.  
Atty Mcmahon does request a new status date.
Hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Miles C Harvey
Current: PO Box 2000, c/o New Lisbon Correctional Institution, New Lisbon, WI 53950 United States  (Effective: 10-04-2022)
Prior: PO Box 661, c/o Dodge Correctional Institution, Waupun, WI 53963 United States

2:46 PM Defendant Miles C Harvey appeared by video, in custody from Dodge Correctional.  Attorney Maura Ann Mcmahon appeared by video for Miles C Harvey.  Prosecuting attorney Abbey Nickolie in court for the State of Wisconsin.
 
Court conducts colloquy with defendant and goes over waiver of right to preliminary hearing on the record. 
The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. 
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial. 
State files information. 
Defense accepts information and waives reading. 
Atty McMahon enters a plea of not guilty. 

Atty McMahon requests a status date.
Hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 8, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Miles C Harvey
Current: PO Box 661, c/o Dodge Correctional Institution, Waupun, WI 53963 United States  (Effective: 08-04-2022)
Prior: 949 North 9th Street, c/o Milwaukee County Jail, Milwaukee, WI 53233 United States
Preliminary hearing on August 4, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Maura McMahon has been appointed to represent the defendant.
Detainer placed at: Milwaukee County Jail
Preliminary hearing on June 16, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

09:37 AM Defendant Miles C Harvey in court, in custody, by zoom from Milwaukee Jail with attorney Maura Ann Mcmahon as friend of the court by zoom.   Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Atty Mcmahon states receipt of the criminal complaint, waives reading and enters not guilty pleas. 
Atty Mcmahon waives time limits on  prelminary hearing and requests a waiver of preliminary hearing date.
All parties are in agreement to have defendant appear by zoom at the next hearing date.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 03:00 pm.  Check Case scheduled for May 9, 2022.
Defendant returned copy of summons filed by District Attorney office
Initial appearance on May 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Miles C Harvey
Current: 949 North 9th Street, c/o Milwaukee County Jail, Milwaukee, WI 53233 United States  (Effective: 04-11-2022)
Prior: N4895 Lake Dr #B, Hustisford, WI 53034

10:48 AM Defendant Miles C Harvey not in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court notes that the Defendant is currently incarcerated in Milwaukee County Jail.
The Court will adjourn.  Initial appearance scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
